statements.sql:
insert into `instructions` (`title`, `description`, `authorId`, `statusId`, `updated_at`, `created_at`) values ('env file in PHP | Installation', '

At present, an env file is an important part of both websites and apps. Now the internet is more complex than it was before. There are many hackers who want to hack your site for no reason. So, it is good to be always prepared. That’s why an env file makes its place in this situation.

Why we should use an env file in the application?

To protect your application sensitive data access you need to use the env file. The sensitive data can be an API credential, MySQL Database login details, Application Rest APIs, etc. Suppose if you don’t use an env file and store all this sensitive data in simple PHP files or other files. Then if someone cracks your site we will also get access to all your these sensitive data along with site files. So, he can misuse this data and put you in trouble. So, that’s why we should use an env file in our application.

A web application file name that starts with a dot (.) like .env .htaccess is not accessible by any users

', 1, 1, '2024-02-02 23:47:06', '2024-02-02 23:47:06')

insert into `snippets` (`title`, `description`, `instructionsId`, `vendorId`, `authorId`, `statusId`, `listPosition`, `updated_at`, `created_at`) values ('go to http root directory', '
cd your_directory_path
', 12, 2, 1, 1, 1, '2024-02-02 23:47:06', '2024-02-02 23:47:06')

insert into `snippets` (`title`, `description`, `instructionsId`, `vendorId`, `authorId`, `statusId`, `listPosition`, `updated_at`, `created_at`) values ('install .env packages with npm', '
composer require vlucas/phpdotenv
', 12, 2, 1, 1, 1, '2024-02-02 23:47:06', '2024-02-02 23:47:06')

insert into `snippets` (`title`, `description`, `instructionsId`, `vendorId`, `authorId`, `statusId`, `listPosition`, `updated_at`, `created_at`) values ('create .env file http root directory', '
APP_NAME=ExampleAPP
APP_VERSION=vX.X.X
APP_REST_API=XXXXX-XXXXXX-XXXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX
Weather_Api=XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX
Weater_Api_Secret=XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX
MySQL_DB_HOST=localhost
MySQL_DB_USER_NAME=exampleuser
MySQL_DB_PASSWORD=XXXXXXXXXXX
MySQL_DB_NAME=example
', 12, 2, 1, 1, 1, '2024-02-02 23:47:06', '2024-02-02 23:47:06')

request.request_request:
array:2 [
  "snippets" => array:5 [
    0 => array:4 [
      "title" => "go to http root directory"
      "description" => "<pre class="language-markup"><code>cd your_directory_path</code></pre>"
      "vendorId" => 2
      "statusId" => 1
    ]
    1 => array:4 [
      "title" => "install .env packages with npm"
      "description" => "<pre class="language-markup"><code>composer require vlucas/phpdotenv</code></pre>"
      "vendorId" => 2
      "statusId" => 1
    ]
    2 => array:4 [
      "title" => "include loader in index.php"
      "description" => """
        <pre class="language-php"><code>require_once realpath(__DIR__ . "/vendor/autoload.php");\n
        use Dotenv\Dotenv;\n
        $dotenv = Dotenv::createImmutable(__DIR__);\n
        $dotenv->load();</code></pre>
        """
      "vendorId" => 2
      "statusId" => 1
    ]
    3 => array:4 [
      "title" => "create .env file http root directory"
      "description" => """
        <pre class="language-markup"><code>APP_NAME=ExampleAPP\n
        APP_VERSION=vX.X.X\n
        APP_REST_API=XXXXX-XXXXXX-XXXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX\n
        Weather_Api=XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX\n
        Weater_Api_Secret=XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX-XXXXX\n
        MySQL_DB_HOST=localhost\n
        MySQL_DB_USER_NAME=exampleuser\n
        MySQL_DB_PASSWORD=XXXXXXXXXXX\n
        MySQL_DB_NAME=example</code></pre>
        """
      "vendorId" => 2
      "statusId" => 1
    ]
    4 => array:4 [
      "title" => "load .env file"
      "description" => """
        <pre class="language-php"><code>//load .env file\n
        require_once realpath(__DIR__ . "/vendor/autoload.php");\n
        use Dotenv\Dotenv;\n
        $dotenv = Dotenv::createImmutable(__DIR__);\n
        $dotenv->load();\n
        //get app name from .env file\n
        $appName = $_ENV['APP_NAME'];\n
        //echo the app name\n
        echo $appName;</code></pre>\n
        <p>Remember you can also use getenv() instead of $_ENV[]. But we discourage you to use getenv() instead of $_ENV[] because of security reasons.</p>
        """
      "vendorId" => 2
      "statusId" => 1
    ]
  ]
  "instruction" => array:10 [
    "title" => "env file in PHP | Installation"
    "description" => """
      <p>At present, an env file is an important part of both websites and apps. Now the internet is more complex than it was before. There are many hackers who want to hack your site for no reason. So, it is good to be always prepared. That’s why an env file makes its place in this situation.</p>\n
      <p id="adc1" class="pw-post-body-paragraph mz na gr nb b nc ov ne nf ng ow ni nj nk ox nm nn no oy nq nr ns oz nu nv nw gk bj" data-selectable-paragraph=""><strong>Why we should use an env file in the application?</strong></p>\n
      <p class="pw-post-body-paragraph mz na gr nb b nc ov ne nf ng ow ni nj nk ox nm nn no oy nq nr ns oz nu nv nw gk bj" data-selectable-paragraph="">To protect your application sensitive data access you need to use the env file. The sensitive data can be an API credential, MySQL Database login details, Application Rest APIs, etc. Suppose if you don’t use an env file and store all this sensitive data in simple PHP files or other files. Then if someone cracks your site we will also get access to all your these sensitive data along with site files. So, he can misuse this data and put you in trouble. So, that’s why we should use an env file in our application.</p>\n
      <p><span style="background-color: rgb(241, 196, 15);"><strong class="nb gs"><em class="gr">A web application file name that starts with a dot (.) like .env .htaccess is not accessible by any users</em></strong></span></p>
      """
    "isDirty" => true
    "errors" => []
    "hasErrors" => false
    "processing" => false
    "progress" => null
    "wasSuccessful" => false
    "recentlySuccessful" => false
    "__rememberable" => true
  ]
]
